text: @EvanCull @ElderlyMan10 @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov It's a nice idea but I can't see it ending well.  We're losing land to housing estates all the time.  I'd rather spend the resources protecting what's already here, rather  than reintroduce a species that was hunted to extinction in the early middle ages.

@trooperinred @ElderlyMan10 @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov depends, you start off with neutered packs to study their behaviour initially and build up to cubs when you have the management strategies pinned down.
@EvanCull @ElderlyMan10 @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov Not very wild if they have collars on.  What about cubs, are the all going to be caught for collar fitting?
@ElderlyMan10 @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov what about technology John?, we have GPS collars nowadays, we can track wildlife movement.
@EvanCull @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov BEARS have legs. They can walk. WHAT IF THEY MAKE IT TO THE PARK??? Use your mind please
@ElderlyMan10 @PoliticsForAlI @YouGov it's about rewilding John not letting the bears loose in the local childrens park.
@PoliticsForAlI @YouGov This is DANGEROUS. who will protect my grandkids at the park??? I VOTE no
